skill.name: chapter-outline-generator
skill.description: Generates comprehensive chapter outlines for books, including key topics, subtopics, learning objectives, and estimated word counts. Use this when the user needs help structuring a book chapter or creating a table of contents.
skill.summary: Generates comprehensive chapter outlines for books, including key topics, subtopics, learning object...
skill.author: AbdulSamad94

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill consisting of a single SKILL.md file with instructional content. No executable code, no file system access, no network calls, no external commands. The skill only provides guidance for generating chapter outlines through AI conversation.

content.value_statement: Authors often struggle to create balanced, comprehensive chapter structures for their books. This skill guides you through building detailed outlines with learning objectives, sections, subsections, and word count estimates.
actual_capabilities: Creates detailed chapter frameworks with titles and summaries
Generates learning objectives for each chapter
Organizes chapters into main sections and subsections
Estimates word counts based on book length
Ensures logical flow and balanced content distribution
Produces markdown-formatted outlines ready for use
limitations: Does not write actual chapter content, only outlines
Requires user input for book details and preferences
Cannot validate factual accuracy of chapter topics
Does not integrate with external writing software

use_cases.title: Plan Mystery Novel Chapters
use_cases.description: Structure fiction chapters with character arcs, plot points, and pacing considerations.

use_cases.title: Outline Business Books
use_cases.description: Create instructional chapters with learning objectives and actionable takeaways for readers.

use_cases.title: Design Educational Content
use_cases.description: Build academic chapters with comprehensive topic coverage and progressive difficulty.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Fiction Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a chapter outline for my [genre] novel titled [title] about [brief premise]. Target audience is [description]. Book length should be approximately [X] words across [Y] chapters.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed Non-Fiction
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a non-fiction book about [topic] for [audience]. The book should cover [key themes] and run approximately [X] words. Include learning objectives and estimated word counts per chapter.

prompt_templates.title: Single Chapter Expansion
prompt_templates.prompt: Expand Chapter [number] of my [book type] about [subject] into detailed sections and subsections. Current chapter focus: [description]. Include learning objectives.

prompt_templates.title: Complete Book Structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a complete chapter outline for a [length] book on [subject] for [audience]. Include chapter summaries, 3-5 learning objectives per chapter, main sections, subsections, and estimated word counts.

output_examples.input: Create a chapter outline for a mystery novel about a detective solving art thefts. First 3 chapters only.
output: **Summary**: Detective Sarah Chen receives a mysterious call about a high-profile art theft...
**Learning Objectives**: Introduce the protagonist and her detective skills; Establish the central mystery...
**Sections**: 1. The Midnight Call; 2. The Crime Scene Investigation...

best_practices: Provide specific book details including genre, target audience, and desired length for best results.
Request modifications if chapter word counts or section counts need adjustment.
Review the outline as a complete document to ensure no topic gaps before writing.
anti_patterns: Asking for complete chapter content instead of outlines.
Providing vague book descriptions that make balanced chapter planning difficult.
Skipping the review step and beginning writing without verifying outline completeness.

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. It provides structured guidance for generating chapter outlines.

faq.question: How detailed are the generated outlines?
faq.answer: Outlines include chapter titles, summaries, 3-5 learning objectives, 3-7 main sections with 2-4 subsections each, and estimated word counts.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing book drafts?
faq.answer: Yes. Describe your current chapter and request expansion or reorganization. The skill helps structure existing content.

faq.question: Is my book content stored or shared?
faq.answer: No. This is a prompt-based skill that operates only within your active AI conversation. No data leaves your session.

faq.question: Why are my chapter outlines uneven?
faq.answer: Uneven outlines often result from vague input. Provide target word counts, chapter preferences, and specific topics for balanced results.

faq.question: How is this different from general AI writing?
faq.answer: This skill follows a proven structural framework specifically designed for book planning with learning objectives and section hierarchies.
